meanings.definition: Not able to be broken or shattered.
meanings.sent1: The diamond was unbreak, even when dropped on the hard floor.
meanings.sent2: The unbreak vase remained intact after the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The unbreak toy car survived being thrown out of the window.
meanings.sent4: Her unbreak spirit inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The unbreak bond between the siblings was heartwarming.

meanings.sent1: He tried to unbreak the stick by bending it gently.
meanings.sent2: The magician's trick was to unbreak the glass with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent3: She managed to unbreak the cookie into two perfect halves.
meanings.sent4: The superhero's mission was to unbreak the curse that plagued the town.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was able to unbreak the engine and get the car running smoothly again.
